definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: He went to pieces when they told him the tragic news.
sentences.chinese: 人们告诉他那悲惨的消息后，他已六神无主了。

sentences.english: Six absolute beings that seven treasures scare were ownerless, entirely had not mind.
sentences.chinese: 七宝吓的六神无主，完全没了主意。

sentences.english: Mr. Slope had thus left her quite bewildered.
sentences.chinese: 因此，斯洛普先生离开她的时候感到六神无主。

sentences.english: Having heard such news, he was frightened out of his sense.
sentences.chinese: 听到这个消息后，他吓得六神无主。

sentences.english: The poor boy was on tenterhooks when his father was searching for a stick.
sentences.chinese: 那个可怜的男孩见父亲到处找棍子，感到六神无主。

definition: at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
one's thoughts in a whirl (idiom); confused/disconcerted/upset
(idiom) to become agitated/to get worked up
lit. body and soul separated (idiom); fig. scared out of one's wits/beside oneself
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
not knowing what to do (idiom); at one's wits' end/embarrassed and at a complete loss
panic-stricken (idiom)/to be in a flustered state/also written 張惶失措|张惶失措[zhang1 huang2 shi1 cuo4]
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
